externalAccounts.heading: Social channels
externalAccounts.subHeading: The Messages API allows you to send messages through social channels (external accounts) as well as SMS and MMS. You'll need a business account/page with each social provider that you can connect to your Vonage APIs account.
externalAccounts.whatsappDesc: Contact sales to apply for your own verified WhatsApp Business Account.
externalAccounts.messengerDesc: Get started instantly by connecting your existing Facebook Business Pages to your Vonage API account.
externalAccounts.viberServiceMsgDesc: Contact sales to apply for your own verified Viber Business Account.
externalAccounts.yourExternalAccountsSubText: Manage the external accounts that have already been connected to your Vonage API account.
externalAccounts.noConnectedAccountMsg: This API key has no external accounts connected to it

tips.tipOneContent: This is the collective term we use for messaging channels that exist outside of the Vonage API platform. Manage them here, or via the API.
tips.tipTwoContent: Discover which channels are right for you and learn more about the rules for how/when you can send messages.
tips.tipThreeContent: Send test messages with WhatsApp, Viber, and Facebook immediately, without waiting for your application to be approved.
tips.tipFourContent: An 'application' is a container for your authentication and configuration settings when using Vonage APIs.

facebookConnect.heading: Connect Facebook Page
facebookConnect.subHeading: The Messages API can send and receive messages from your Facebook Business Pages. To get started you'll need to authenticate your Facebook account with Vonage.
facebookConnect.stepOneLabel: Log in and authorize Vonage to access your Facebook Business Pages.
facebookConnect.stepTwoLabel: Choose which page Vonage can access. If you have multiple pages, you'll need to repeat these steps for each additional page.
facebookConnect.stepThreeLabel: Each Facebook page can only be connected to one API key at a time. If you need a test environment, we suggest creating a second Facebook page or use the
facebookConnect.connectToFacebookRequired: Please connect to Facebook to continue

pageEdit.title: Edit
pageEdit.messengerSubHeading: Your basic Facebook indentifier information for the page that is registered with Vonage
pageEdit.messengerIdHint: The facebook profile linked to your Vonage account

pageEdit.messengerExpirationMsgPart1: Your authentication token for this page will expire in
pageEdit.whatsappSubHeading: Use this page to keep your WhatsApp profile up to date. This information will be publicly visible in the WhatsApp mobile app.
pageEdit.whatsappNameHint: The name associated with this number. It can't be updated here.
pageEdit.whatsappIdHint: The phone number associated with this account. It can't be updated here.
pageEdit.aboutHint: A brief description seen by new users whenever they contact your business profile.
pageEdit.businessProfileSubText: Your Business profile will show up when people tap to see your full contact info in the WhatsApp mobile app.
pageEdit.addressHint: Physical address address that will be visible to everyone.
pageEdit.contactEmailHint: Email address address that will be visible to everyone.
pageEdit.websiteHint: Your business domain. URLs will be hyperlinked.
pageEdit.businessDescriptionHint: A longer description of your business profile. URLs will not be hyperlinked.
pageEdit.logoHint: Must be a square JPG or PNG with max dimensions of 640px by 640px and a max file size of 800kb. If the image is larger, WhatsApp will automatically center crop the image to these dimensions.

team.temporaryPasswordSent: A temporary password has been sent to {email}

team.autoreloadCannotDelete: Cannot delete this team member as s/he has auto reload payments enabled. Before you may proceed with deletion, you will need that team member to log in and switch off auto reload.

modal.deleteConfirmationText: Are you sure that you want to perform this action?
modal.restrictionsSectionText: By default all account users have the ability to look up and buy numbers, make payments, view payment history, use search tools, maintain API settings and create and manage applications.
modal.secondaryUserTerms: The data you provide will be treated in accordance with our Privacy Policy, which sets out the rights individuals have over how we treat their data.
modal.secondaryUserMayHaveToLoginAgain: Changing restrictions may require the user to log in again.
modal.warningMessage: Enabling team member {emailToWarn} to manage other team members will allow them to remove any restriction you have enabled previously, giving them the same capabilities of a primary user.
modal.pleaseCheckAtLeastOneKey: Please select at least one API key.

edit.editSubHeader: Use applications to store authentication settings, external accounts, and webhooks for handling inbound and outbound traffic to/from Vonage APIs.
edit.name: Name
edit.nameHint: Give a friendly identifier to your application.
edit.apiKeyHint: An application must be bound to a specific API key.
edit.authenticationSub: Vonage APIs (Voice, Messages, Conversation, etc) use JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) for authentication. The JWTs must be signed with the private key of this application. Either provide your own keys, or we can generate them for you.
edit.generateTootlip: This will trigger a one time download of your private key. Vonage will never store a copy of it.
edit.capabilitiesSub: Turn on capabilities that you want to use with this application. You can add and remove capabilities at any time.
edit.voiceSub: Create calls, control calls in-progress, get information about previous calls, and more.
edit.eventUrlTooltip: We will send events to this URL when there are status changes during a call (ringing, answered, busy, etc) - learn more
edit.answerUrlTooltip: When receiving an inbound call, we will make a request to this URL to download your NCCO.
edit.fallbackUrlTooltip: If your Answer or Event URL are offline or return an HTTP error code, we will attempt to retrieve your NCCO from here instead.
edit.customWebhookTimeoutsSub: Override the platform defaults by providing your own custom timeout values (in milliseconds).
edit.rtcSub: Create conversations with in-app voice, in-app messaging, and custom events.
edit.rtcEventUrlHint: We will send RTC events to this URL.
edit.messagesSub: Communicate with WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, MMS and Viber.
edit.inboundUrlTooltip: We will forward inbound messages to this URL.
edit.statusUrlTooltip: We will send message status updates (for example, delivered, seen) to this URL.
edit.vbcSub: Vonage Business Communications customers can turn this on to enable the Smart Numbers add-on.

apiKeySettings.secretAddedMessage: Your new API secret was successfully added to your account
apiKeySettings.signatureSecretTip: Signature secret key is used to create the signature for API requests in order for you to confirm that the content has not been modified in transit.
apiKeySettings.signatureMethodTip: The Signature method will define the function/algorithm used to create the signature.
apiKeySettings.deleteSecretText: By clicking on 'Delete' you will remove your secret:
apiKeySettings.confirmationQuestion: Are you sure you want to do it?
apiKeySettings.addSecretTip: Secret rotation enables two API secrets to be used against one API key at the same time. This way you can test the new secret before revoking the old one.
apiKeySettings.secretValidationHeader: API secret must have at least:

smsSettings.defaultSmsSettingsHint: Set default Webhook URLs to use with the SMS API
smsSettings.deliveryReceiptsTip: When sending SMS, delivery receipts will be forwarded to this webhook endpoint.
smsSettings.inboundMessagesTip: If you want to receive inbound messages, you'll need to provide a URL for us to forward them to. You can override this on a per number basis by configuring your number settings.

smpp.title: SMPP settings
smpp.subText: Configure your SMPP settings for this API key
smpp.dlrFormat: DLR Format Message ID is Hex

notifcationSettings.lowBalanceAlertsDesc: Low balance alerts can now be configured on the
notifcationSettings.numberSubscriptionsLabel: Receive an email whenever my number subscriptions are close to renewal.
notifcationSettings.numberSubscriptionsTooltip: We will email the account owner seven days before any of their virtual number subscriptions renew.
notifcationSettings.displayCurrencyLabel: The dashboard can do a simple currency conversion to show your balance in USD.
notifcationSettings.displayCurrencyHint: Please note this is just a visual change for your convenience. Your bill, top ups, and invoices are still calculated in EUR.
notifcationSettings.pricingUpdateLabel: If you want to be notified of any upcoming pricing changes, provide a list of email recipients, separated by commas.

porting.title: Port your numbers
porting.introDetails: Transfer your existing US or Canadian numbers to Nexmo from other providers. Other countries are not currently supported.
porting.helpStep1: Provide contact information for anyone else who should receive number transfer updates
porting.helpStep2: List the numbers you'd like to port and their current providers
porting.helpStep3: Download and submit your completed Letter of Authorization (LoA)
porting.docsRequirement: This feature doesn't support bulk porting. Instead you'll need to contact support with details about your current provider. Please allow extra time for this process.
porting.selectAccountMsg: Which API key (sub-account) are you porting to?
porting.vonageAcceptTerms: I understand that by using this feature, the information I submit will be stored by Vonage managed infrastructure in the United States of America.
porting.vonageRedirectMsg: You will be directed to the Vonage Business website to complete your number transfer request

voiceLogSearch.calloutContent: Don't use leading + or 00 when entering a phone number, start with the country code. See destination number format for more information.
voiceLogSearch.downloadSubText: You can currently download up to 2,000 calls at once. If you select a time period with more than 2,000 calls, only the first 2,000 will be downloaded.
voiceLogSearch.downloadRejectedSubText: You can currently download up to 1,000 calls at once. If you select a time period with more than 1,000 calls, only the first 1,000 will be downloaded.

verifyLogSearch.downloadSubText: You can currently download up to 2,000 calls at once. If you select a time period with more than 2,000 calls, only the first 2,000 will be downloaded.

yourNumbers.subTitle: Manage your virtual phone numbers and configure their settings.

yourNumbers.calloutText1: Effectively immediately, we are no longer accepting the registration of new message templates for Shared Short Codes. From
yourNumbers.calloutText2: T-Mobile and AT&T's new code of conduct will prohibit the use of shared originators for A2P (application to person) traffirow. Please migrate any existing Shared Short Code traffic to one of our alternative solutions.

alert.calloutContentLine1: If your message after variable substitution is greater than 160 characters, then multiple SMS messages will be used and will increase your bill.
alert.calloutContentLine2: For example, if your marketing message per customer spans two SMS messages, you will be billed for two SMS messages per customer.
alert.calloutContentLine3: We recommend you  review the values that you are going to use for variable  substitution, and reflect on how they will increase your total character count.
alert.subTitle: Create your own alert
alert.dynamixParamTooltip: To include dynamic parameters in your message use the following syntax: ${param_name}.
alert.lengthHintEnd: plus the length of the text that you will use for variable substitution.

studio.title: Vonage AI Studio
studio.subtitle: Add artificial intelligence to your apps!
studio.line1: Vonage AI Studio is a drag and drop workflow builder for creating virtual Voice agents powered by artificial intelligence.
studio.line2: AI Studio will use your Vonage API account to make and receive voice calls.
studio.line3: This is a new product offering from Vonage that you have early access to.
